benefit.translation[0].definitions[0].de: an advantage, improvement, or help that you get from something
benefit.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: I never had the benefit of a university education.
The new credit cards will be of great benefit to our customers.
I hope that the decision taken today will be to the benefit of the whole nation.
Could you just explain again for Mark’s benefit?
Most motorists manage without the benefit of four-wheel drive.
benefit.translation[0].definitions[1].de: money provided by the government to people who are sick, unemployed, or have little money
benefit.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: those people eligible to claim benefit
You might be entitled to housing benefit.
benefit.translation[0].definitions[2].de: extra money or other advantages that you get as part of your job or from insurance that you have
benefit.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: We offer an excellent benefits package.
benefit.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: All the hotel rooms have the benefit of a balcony.
In this way, students will gain maximum benefit from their classes.
You’ll enjoy all the benefits of being a member.
He was looking forward to reaping the benefits of all his hard work.

Make sure that the risks don’t outweigh the benefits.

They will have the full benefit of our facilities.

Just 30 minutes of moderate daily activity yields health benefits.

The potential benefits of the scheme must be weighed against the costs involved.

benefit.translation[1].definitions[0].de: if you benefit from something, or it benefits you, it gives you an advantage, improves your life, or helps you in some way
benefit.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: They are working together to benefit the whole community.
I’m sure you’ll benefit greatly from the visit.
Many thousands have benefited from the new treatment.
They would benefit by reducing their labour costs.
benefit.translation[2].definitions[0].de: a good effect or advantage that something has, for example a product or service
benefit.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: We will focus our marketing message on the environmental benefits of the product.
The system offers real benefits to the consumer.
benefit.translation[2].definitions[1].de: money provided by the government to people who are old and no longer work, or to people who are unemployed, ill, or on a low income etc
benefit.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: the number of people out of work and receiving benefit

benefit.translation[2].definitions[2].de: money paid out on certain insurance policies, especially health insurance
benefit.translation[2].definitions[2].ex: In the event of a justified claim, permanent total disablement benefit will be payable from the date of the claimant’s disablement.
benefit.translation[2].definitions[3].de: something, especially money, that an employer gives to workers in addition to their normal pay, to encourage them to work harder or be satisfied where they work
benefit.translation[2].definitions[3].ex: The company offers an excellent salary and benefits package, including relocation costs.
benefit.translation[3].definitions[0].de: to get help or an advantage from something
benefit.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: The taxpayer benefits because we do not have to borrow public money from the Treasury.
This sector will benefit from lower borrowing costs.
benefit.translation[3].definitions[1].de: to give someone help or advantage
benefit.translation[3].definitions[1].ex: The increase in house prices in the past 30 years has mainly benefited the comfortably-off.
